title: Minnesota Department of Corrections
text:
The Minnesota Department of Corrections is a state law enforcement agency of <a href="Minnesota">Minnesota</a> that operates <a href="prison">prison</a>s. Its headquarters is in <a href="St.%20Paul%2C%20Minnesota">St. Paul</a>.
As of 2010, the state of Minnesota does not contract with private prisons. The first and only private prison in the state, the <a href="Prairie%20Correctional%20Facility">Prairie Correctional Facility</a>, was closed by its owner in 2010.
The head of the agency is referred to as the Commissioner. , the holder of this office is <a href="Paul%20Schnell">Paul Schnell</a>.
Juvenile services.
The department operates juvenile correctional facilities.
<a href="Minnesota%20Correctional%20Facility%20%E2%80%93%20Red%20Wing">Minnesota Correctional Facility – Red Wing</a> in <a href="Red%20Wing%2C%20Minnesota">Red Wing</a> serves delinquent boys. It was built in 1889. Minnesota Correctional Facility – <a href="Togo%2C%20Minnesota">Togo</a> in northern <a href="Itasca%20County%2C%20Minnesota">Itasca County</a> no longer serves delinquent boys and girls. The Togo facility opened in 1955 as Youth Conservation Commission (YCC). For years it was known as Thistledew Camp. In 2006 the facility's name changed to MCF-Togo, and the Thistledew designation is used to refer to the juvenile programs. Now MCF-TOGO only serves adult males as a CIP program
